'My mother carried me on her back, under fire': Life around Haiti's gang-squeezed capital
subhead: Haiti has 1.4 million displaced people who are victims of the criminal gangs that control much of the greater Port-au-Prince area. Recently, law enforcement and militias have appeared to halt their progress.

Sarkozy to publish new memoir, 'Diary of a Prisoner,' ahead of appeal
subhead: The former French president spent three weeks in detention in La Santé prison this autumn. His book will be released on December 10, his publisher announced on Friday.

title: The 'everlasting peace' in Gaza promised by Trump is off to a troubled start
subhead: The US president described the UN Security Council's vote on phase II of his peace plan as the dawn 'a golden age for the Middle East.' But how can we separate this bluster from actual reality, asks Le Monde columnist Alain Frachon.

title: How Macron enlisted regional papers in his fight against social media's 'fake news'
subhead: To organize his 'Tour of France' on the dangers of the digital world, the president called on the regional daily press to organize debates with the French public.

title: 'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.

Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US: 'You are effectively blacklisted by much of the world's banking system'
subhead: Six judges and three prosecutors at the International Criminal Court have been sanctioned by the Trump administration. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou discusses the impact of these measures on his work and daily life.

title: Inequality on the rise in France amid a staggering surge in income among the ultrarich
subhead: The wealthiest 0.1% of French people earn, on average, 167 times more than the quarter of households with the lowest incomes, according to France's National Institute of Statistics and Economic Studies. The gap has widened dramatically over the past 20 years, while reforms introduced by Emmanuel Macron have reduced the tax rate for the richest households.

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.
